Company Name Tiffany & Co. Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Blue Box

Tiffany & Co., a Symbol of Excellence. The name instills images of Beauty, Romance and Effortless Style. For over 175 years, Tiffany has created a legacy of exquisite designs and romantic ideals.

Our Melbourne Airport boutique is looking for passionate and customer focused Full-Time Sales Professional to join the team. As a Sales Professional, you are a part of the milestones of our customers' lives. You will be building meaningful relationships, fulfilling your client's needs, and ensuring each client receives a personalised Tiffany experience.

Style Your Days in a World of Luxury

For many of our customers, a visit to Tiffany is something to be treasured. Whether they are pampering themselves with an indulgent treat or shopping for a memorable gift. They bring us their greatest dreams – of style, glamour and love – and it is our obligation to honor those dreams with grace and artful understanding.

In Your Role You Will
  • Proactively communicate with our clients, ensuring the Tiffany Experience - uniquely tailored and personalised customer service.
  • Deliver an uncompromising luxurious experience, maintaining efficiency in a fast paced environment.
  • Act as our brand ambassador, representing the elegance of our iconic brand and influence your customers with timeless style.
In return, you will earn a very competitive salary, the opportunity for career development in an environment that recognizes growth, whilst receiving Tiffany designed training programs and the privilege of generous employee discounts.

Blue Box. White Ribbon. That’s a wrap.

The successful candidate will have a minimum of three years sales experience within a customer -focused environment. Be it Retail, Hospitality or Aviation…We believe a diverse workforce makes a difference. A dynamic service-driven personality is essential!

We Are Seeking
  • A Blue Box Enthusiast.
  • An individual with a genuine interest in art of styling and self-driven motivation to stay on point!
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with a diverse client base and collaborate with colleagues.
  • Flexibility to work traditional retail trading hours, including weekdays and weekends, late nights and holidays
  • Candidates who are bi-lingual (preferably Mandarin) will have an advantage.
The next in the process is for you to complete a pre-hire assessment, in which you will be e-mailed the link after submitting your application.

An inspired career is life’s best accessory.

As a Electrical Design Drafter, you will be responsible for working along side the capability manager and lead drafter to create and complete CAD designs on Melbourne based substation projects.



About the role
In this role you will bring extensive MicroStation and AutoCAD knowledge. Your skill and abilities will stretch across a vast amount of infrastructure and transport substation projects.

Internal Communications Specialist Coordinator

Company Name 7-Eleven Australia Company Location 357 Ferntree Gully Road, Mount Waverley, VIC 3149, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 44 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

An exciting, brand new, opportunity exists for an Internal Communications Coordinator to join our Corporate Affairs team. Reporting directly to the Internal Communications Manager, the successful candidate will join a high performing team and will be responsible for implementing a range of internal communications activities across the 7-Eleven network.


If you’re an amazing writer who is bursting with ideas to develop creative content for digital channels, for us this includes but is not limited to an eNewsletter, The Hub app, Yammer, intranet, and videos, and supporting the delivery of initiatives as part of the broader corporate affairs strategy, then this is the perfect role for you. An exciting part of this role is to identify opportunities to increase staff engagement as well as monitoring and reporting on internal communications activities to evaluate effectiveness.


Additionally, you will provide support to the Corporate Affairs team through the delivery of team member events, launches and campaigns, and promoting our community partnership program, Good Cause.


We’re looking for a candidate who can help us elevate our internal communications program. We have great stories to share about our growing business and exciting channels in which to share them with our stakeholders. There is lots of opportunity to contribute to our team’s work and we look forward to welcoming your creativity.


To be successful in this role you will have:

\xa0

  • A Communications/Journalist/Public Relations or similar degree will be highly regarded
  • Previous experience in a fast paced corporate affairs/communications/public relations/journalism environment would be ideal
  • \xa0An excellent communicator, you are confident in engaging with a range of stakeholders across a variety of channels
  • Excellent writing skills and ability to develop creative and engaging content is essential
  • A natural organiser, you are efficient and able to prioritise, enabling you to confidently manage conflicting deadlines
  • Working within agreed parameters you are always looking for additional opportunities to further engage with your stakeholders
  • As a fabulous team player you are excited by the opportunity to be part of a high performing team
  • A self-starter you can manage the tasks at hand but you also have the maturity to ask for assistance when required
  • Finally, you have a natural flair for design combined with previous knowledge and/or experience using design software

Retail Field Coach VIC

Company Name Caltex Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 111 views

Be an early applicant

Job description



* Bring your high energy and facilitation experience
* Join an energetic and passionate team

At Caltex, we're making life easier for our customers by reinventing our convenience retail and fuel offering. With more than three million weekly customer interactions, we have a huge
opportunity to make an impact not just on our customers, but across our 1900 stores
around Australia.

We are currently looking for an enthusiastic Retail Field Coach to join our Retail team in VIC. This role delivers effective and engaging training solutions that build organisational capability across our retail business.

You'll take us further by:

* Facilitating operational and behavioural training that engages the audience, meets learning objectives and enables change
* Coordinating the logistics of training delivery and administering participant training and attendance records
* Coordinating the training calendar, budget reporting and other ad hoc administration
* Maintaining positive relationships across the Retails Operations business to support training needs
* Assisting in the development and review of training content and initiatives

To be successful you will:

* A Certificate IV in Training and Assessment and facilitation experience
* Experience in the Retail industry
* Strong computer skills including Microsoft office suite and ideally, a Learning Management System

We'll take you further by:

* Offering competitive salary and bonus structures
* Providing professional development and training opportunities
* Welcoming you to our highly-regarded and fun team who are passionate about delivering best in class training solutions to our Retail Business
* Embracing what makes you unique and leveraging your individual strengths in our flexible and inclusive workplace

If we've got your interest, we encourage you to submit an application because we would love to tell you more. Click 'Apply Online' below to register your interest.


At Caltex, we're with you all the way. We keep millions of people moving every day, and continue to be Australia's leading transport fuel supplier and a growing convenience retailer. We're a diverse, multi-faceted business full of people ready to make a difference, and we're evolving which means we've got a variety of career opportunities In different areas.

Our culture is open and team-orientated and lets our employees be themselves while achieving great results. Our core company values - Connect to win, Find new ways, Own it, Make a difference for customers and Never stop caring- act as a roadmap to ensure we continue to make life easier for our customers, for our partners and for each other.

Working at Caltex has many potential benefits, including:

  • Flexible work options (enabled through technology)
  • Career development opportunities
  • BabyCare Package (including a BabyCare bonus).
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Corporate health plans
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Study reimbursement
  • Opportunities to relocate intra and interstate
  • Employee Share Scheme
  • Personal Performance Bonus and Company Incentive Scheme
  • Two x Star Card with a 25% fuel discount, for a privately-owned private-use vehicle


We strongly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and female candidates to apply.

Stakeholder Engagement Advisor - Infrastructure

Company Name Robert Walters Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Located on the fringe of the Melbourne CBD, this civil contractor is responsible for delivering one of the States most iconic infrastructure projects. Due to growth and ongoing demand, there is an exciting opportunity for a Stakeholder Engagement Advisor to jump on board and support the greater team with internal and external stakeholder communication pieces.


Reporting to the Manager for Stakeholder Engagement, the Stakeholder Engagement Advisor will be responsible for working collaboratively with the team to ensure that key messages and construction updates are channeled to the correct audiences.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Engage with councils, construction contractors community and industry associations
  • Support the development of collateral including project newsletters, fact sheets, project updates, FAQs for website and print
  • Identify issues, risks and opportunities and provide appropriate strategies
  • Oversee project updates for print and digital media
  • Advise the State Stakeholder Engagement Manager of outcomes or issues arising from Project review meetings, Project workshops, key stakeholder workshops, Community Liaison Group meetings, and Social Service Providers forums


Key Requirements:

  • Strong experience in stakeholder and community engagement ideally within the infrastructure, transport or logistic sectors
  • Working knowledge and understanding of digital media and digital technologies to support community engagement
  • Demonstrated team leadership experience
  • High level verbal and written skills including the writing and delivery of strategies, plans and communications materials
  • Demonstrated issues and risk management on complex projects
  • Ability to work with diverse stakeholders in politically sensitive environments
  • Demonstrated creative thinking and problem-solving skills, with a capacity to respond to and manage changing priorities
  • Degree qualified in Journalism, Communications, PR or related field





To apply please click apply or call Kris Gale on 03 8628 2259 for a confidential discussion.

Executive Assistant

Company Name Daimler Truck and Bus Australia Pacific Company Location 44 Lexia Place, Mulgrave, Melbourne, VIC 3170, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 22 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

A fantastic opportunity exists for a highly organised and dynamic individual to develop their career as an Executive Assistant at Daimler Truck and Bus head office. \xa0In this diverse and fast-paced role, you will be responsible for providing professional and timely administration, research and marketing support to the Director, Mercedes-Benz Truck and Bus and the wider team.


Your responsibilities will include:
\xa0
- \xa0Managing the Director’s diary on a daily basis, frequently preparing local, and overseas travel itineraries, booking flights and accommodation;
- \xa0Preparing and formatting correspondence, bulletins to the dealer network, presentations, newsletters, and reports;
- \xa0Supporting the Director and team with travel bookings, processing expenses and related systems administration;
- \xa0Assisting with event logistics, marketing administration and coordination;
- \xa0Assisting in the preparation of documents for all meetings and presentations;
- \xa0Providing secretarial support to the Director and Senior Managers including arranging meetings, minute taking and processing expense reports;
- \xa0Offering professional and efficient customer service to internal & external customers at all times.

\xa0


This is an ideal opportunity for a proactive, flexible and positive individual to make this role their own. You will have a proven track record in administration, where you have developed excellent organisational skills and demonstrated an ability to be intuitive, innovative and show initiative. Your exceptional time management skills will allow you to handle multiple tasks and priorities while staying ‘in touch’ with the business, taking a genuine interest in its progress. Your ability to maintain the highest level of discretion, confidentiality and diplomacy, will be essential to your success in this role. Most importantly, you are able to anticipate the needs and requirements of the Director and want to bring new ideas to the team.


You will be able to work autonomously and proactively, utilising your strong interpersonal and communication skills to respond to employees, suppliers and customers on all levels. Your desire to support, coordinate and engage with the wider Mercedes-Benz Truck and Bus team will support our goal to ensure ‘best fit’ for this role. Preferably, you will also be degree educated, although this is not essential.
\xa0
This challenging role will provide you with an exceptional opportunity to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, within a rapidly growing business and with excellent support for your career development longer term.
\xa0 \xa0


\xa0

At Daimler Truck and Bus Australia Pacific, we believe our people make the difference. We proudly offer generous employee benefits, such as discounted car leasing and purchase options, on-site parking, employee assistance programs and much more. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We are proud to be recognized as a Workplace Gender Equality Employer of Choice and we support a flexible and progressive work culture. We actively recognize our committed people through Employee Recognition and Reward programs. We also provide exciting learning and career development opportunities.

Company Name GOLD FIELDS Company Location Laverton, AU

New Posted Date Posted 17 hours ago Number of views 30 views

Job description

Role Details

Gold Fields Australia is currently seeking an Operator: Mobile Plant to join their Processing department at Granny Smith Gold Mine. This role is offered on an 8 days on, 6 days off, 7 nights on, 7 days off roster and is FIFO from Perth.

Reporting to the Supervisor: Process, you will be responsible for the safe, secure and efficient operation of different mobile plant machinery.

Key Responsibilities Will Include
  • Always act in a manner that seeks to enhance the safety culture and performance of GFA and ensures that the Vital Behaviours are adhered to at all times.
  • Maintain a high level of health, safety and environmental awareness and comply with all relevant policies and procedures
  • Maximise return on assets through effective utilisation and prompt identification and diagnosis of items on the plant that require preventative maintenance or repair.
  • Carry out statutory workplace inspections and monitor other employees and contractors in their tasks.
  • Ensure all records for the operation of mobile equipment are accurately maintained.
  • Assessing potential hazards and making the necessary changes to eliminate or control them.

Key factors to your success include;
  • Experience in working in rural areas and autonomously
  • Minimum 5years’ experience in operating heavy mobile equipment especially using a digger loader combination machine
  • Possess a current “HR” WA Driver’s License
  • Apply First Aid, Dogging and Confined Space tickets are desirable
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

Interested parties should submit a detailed curriculum vitae to: https://careers.goldfields.com.au

Gold Fields is committed to the achievement and maintenance of diversity and equity in employment. We are committed to achieving a diverse and inclusive workforce, and strongly encourage applications from Female, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates .
